main event: A bright light resembling the size of a dime at arm's length was observed traveling eastward in erratic maneuvers across the sky in Klamath Falls, Oregon on August 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as bluish-white in color and was observed for about 10 minutes.
The sighting occurred in clear skies with visible stars.
No definite identification could be made, but it was believed to be possibly a meteor or some other natural phenomenon.
The Project Blue Book report indicates insufficient data for evaluation, and there was no photograph present in the report.
It was a ground-radar observation with one object seen, bouncing to the west, and the length of observation was not specified.
result: possibly a meteor or some other natural phenomenon
sighted object: a bright light resembling the size of a dime at arm's length
